member.name: F:Sketchball.Controls.GameView.MAX_FPS
member.summary: Arbitrarily chosen FPS number that controls the update interval. We only have lose control over the visual update process i.e. we don't know when the update is done. If we use an update worker, we may be too fast and thus block user input. Furthermore, we would have to use a Dispatcher, which would make the application more prone to errors. By using a common timer with a certain tick rate, we may lose some accuracy, but in exchange Windows can take care of it all.

member.summary: Loads a pinball machine from a file.

member.summary: Loads a pinball machine from an input stream.

member.name: M:Sketchball.Elements.PinballMachine.IsValid
member.summary: Gets whether or not this is a valid pinball machine. You can query the problem found with LastProblem.

member.name: P:Sketchball.Elements.PinballMachine.LastProblem
member.summary: Last problem that was detected. ALWAYS use in conjunction with IsValid().

member.name: M:Sketchball.Elements.PinballMachine.BringToFront(Sketchball.Elements.PinballElement)
member.summary: Brings an element to front for drawing.

member.summary: Positions a ball so that it will fall into the ramp.

member.name: M:Sketchball.Elements.StartingRamp.Contains(Sketchball.Elements.Ball)

member.returns: Whether or not the ball is in this ramp.

member.summary: Sets or gets the scale of this element.

member.summary: Gets whether or not this element reflects the ball.

member.summary: Gets the current game machine. Helper property.

member.name: P:Sketchball.Elements.PinballElement.BounceFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the bounce factor of the element.

member.summary: Gets the bounding container of this element.

member.name: M:Sketchball.Elements.PinballElement.InitResources
member.summary: Loads all required resources into the memory. Always gets called from the STA thread and BEFORE the actual draw.

member.name: M:Sketchball.Elements.PinballElement.GetRotationOrigin
member.summary: Returns the exact coordinates of the origin where the element is to be rotated.

member.name: M:Sketchball.Elements.PinballElement.Contains(System.Windows.Point)
member.summary: Checks whether or not a point lies within an element. This method conducts a *real* pixel check.

member.name: M:Sketchball.Elements.PinballElement.Init
member.summary: Initializes an element. It is important to understand the difference between Init() and the costructor. - The constructor is *only* called when the element is first created. Use it to initialize fields that will be serialized. - The Init() method is called _before_ the child constructor and after each deserialization. Use it to initialize fields that are NOT serialized. (e.g. bounding boxes)

member.name: M:Sketchball.Elements.PinballElement.OnClone(Sketchball.Elements.PinballElement)
member.summary: Does additional stuff when an element is cloned.

member.name: M:Sketchball.Elements.PinballElement.EnterGame(Sketchball.Elements.PinballGameMachine)
member.summary: Sets up event listeners when a new machine is entered.

member.name: M:Sketchball.Elements.PinballElement.LeaveGame(Sketchball.Elements.PinballGameMachine)
member.summary: Removes event listeners when a machine is left

member.name: M:Sketchball.Elements.PinballElement.RegenerateBounds
member.summary: Regenerates all bounding boxes of this element. Calls Init() and thus might also do other things.

member.name: T:Sketchball.GameComponents.GameWorld
member.summary: Represents the "world"/"scene" in which the pinball machine is placed. Purely of graphical relevance.

member.summary: Draws the entire world with the PinballMachine at (0,0). Refer to Width and Height to get the notebook-aware dimensions.

member.summary: Gets the notebook-aware width (width + paddings and margins)

member.name: P:Sketchball.GameComponents.GameWorld.Height
member.summary: Gets the notebook-aware height (height + paddings + margins)

member.name: P:Sketchball.GameComponents.GameWorld.Offset

member.summary: Represents a camera that cna draw part of a GameWorld.+

member.summary: Redoes a change if possible.

member.name: M:GlideTween.Glide.Tween(System.Object,System.Object,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Tweens a set of numeric properties on an object.
member.param: The values to tween to, in an anonymous type ( new { prop1 = 100, prop2 = 0} ).
Duration of the tween in seconds.
Delay before the tween starts, in seconds.
member.returns: The tween created, for setting properties on.

member.name: M:GlideTween.Glide.Timer(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Starts a simple timer for setting up callback scheduling.
member.param: How long the timer will run for, in seconds.
How long to wait before starting the timer, in seconds.
member.returns: The tween created, for setting properties.

member.summary: Set a function to call when the tween begins (useful when using delays).
member.param: The function that will be called when the tween starts, after the delay.

member.name: M:GlideTween.Glide.OnComplete(System.Action)
member.summary: Set a function to call when the tween finishes. If the tween repeats infinitely, this will be called each time; otherwise it will only run when the tween is finished repeating.
member.param: The function that will be called on tween completion.

member.name: M:GlideTween.Glide.OnUpdate(System.Action)
member.summary: Set a function to call as the tween updates.

member.name: M:GlideTween.Glide.Repeat(System.Int32)
member.summary: Enable repeating.
member.param: Number of times to repeat. Leave blank or pass a negative number to repeat infinitely.

member.name: M:GlideTween.Glide.Reflect
member.summary: Sets the tween to reverse every other time it repeats. Repeating must be enabled for this to have any effect.

member.name: M:GlideTween.Glide.Reverse
member.summary: Swaps the start and end values of the tween.

member.name: M:GlideTween.Glide.Rotation
member.summary: Whether this tween handles rotation.

member.name: M:GlideTween.Glide.Round
member.summary: Whether tweened values should be rounded to integer values.

member.name: M:GlideTween.Glide.Cancel
member.summary: Remove tweens from the tweener without calling their complete functions.

member.name: M:GlideTween.Glide.CancelAndComplete
member.summary: Assign tweens their final value and remove them from the tweener.

member.name: M:GlideTween.Glide.Pause
member.summary: Set tweens to pause. They won't update and their delays won't tick down.

member.name: M:GlideTween.Glide.PauseToggle
member.summary: Toggle tweens' paused value.

member.name: M:GlideTween.Glide.Resume
member.summary: Resumes tweens from a paused state.

member.name: M:GlideTween.Glide.TargetCancel(System.Object[])
member.summary: Look up tweens by the objects they target, and cancel them.
member.param: The objects being tweened that you want to cancel.

member.name: M:GlideTween.Glide.TargetCancelAndComplete(System.Object[])
member.summary: Look up tweens by the objects they target, cancel them, set them to their final values, and call the complete callback.
member.param: The objects being tweened that you want to cancel and complete.

member.name: M:GlideTween.Glide.TargetPause(System.Object[])
member.summary: Look up tweens by the objects they target, and pause them.
member.param: The objects being tweened that you want to pause.

member.name: M:GlideTween.Glide.TargetPauseToggle(System.Object[])
member.summary: Look up tweens by the objects they target, and toggle their paused states.
member.param: The objects being tweened that you want to toggle pause.

member.name: M:GlideTween.Glide.TargetResume(System.Object[])
member.summary: Look up tweens by the objects they target, and resume them from paused.
member.param: The objects being tweened that you want to resume.
